Class QuestionBox

  • java.lang.Object
    • application.QuestionBox

  • public class QuestionBox
extends java.lang.Object
    ConfirmBox class utilizes an internal display method to confirm a user action
    Author:
    Derek DiLeo

    • Method Detail

      • display

        public static java.lang.String[] display(java.lang.String[] prompts,
                                         java.lang.String[] defaultEntries,
                                         java.lang.String[] alertBox)
        Method that asks the user a question and returns a String of either their response or, if left blank, a default response which in passed from the caller.
        Parameters:
        prompts - is a String array that contains the all of the text variables for the window (title, heading, labels, etc).
        defaultEntries - direct the app to parse EAP's The Raven (per professor's original instructions).
        alertBox - holds title and message Strings to provide user with some instructions at launch.
        Returns:
        String array of the user's responses.

      • isValidURL

        public static boolean isValidURL(java.lang.String urlString)
        Method to validate URL entered by user.
        Parameters:
        urlString - is the URL passed into QuestionBox by user.
        Returns:
        boolean value of URL validity: valid = true.

      • areValidEntries

        public static boolean areValidEntries(java.lang.String start,
                                      java.lang.String end)
        Method to ensure start and end fields are not left blank.
        Parameters:
        start - is the start field passed into QuestionBox by user.
        end - is the end field passed into QuestionBox by user.
        Returns:
        boolean if both are not left blank.
